com.taursys.xml
Class ComponentFactory

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.taursys.xml.ComponentFactory
Direct Known Subclasses:
HTMLComponentFactory
public abstract class ComponentFactory
extends java.lang.Object

UNDER CONSTRUCTION: ComponentFactory is used to automate the creation of Components based on the XML Document and its Elements. It determines the Component type based on its element tag (and sometimes its id attribute).

The component can be bound automatically to value holders using a naming convention for the ID attribute of the tag. The ID is divided into 2 or three parts. The parts are separated by a double underscore ('__'). The first part is the ALIAS for the ValueHolder. The second part is the property name for the ValueHolder. The optional third part is a number to ensure unique ID's if you want to reference the column more than once in your xml document (unique ID's required by XML/HTML spec). The following are some examples:

  • BOOK__CATALOG_NO - refers to a ValueHolder that has an alias of BOOK and binds it to the property CATALOG_NO.
  • BOOK__LOCATION_ID__1 - refers to the ValueHolder that has an alias of BOOK and binds it to the property LOCATION_ID. This ID is made unique by adding the __1.
There is a special ID format reserved to identify a Template component. The format is identical to the above format, except that the property name is always TEMPLATE_NODE.

Method Detail

getDefaultComponent

public java.lang.String getDefaultComponent(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
Returns default Component class name for given Element. This method will choose the appropriate Component based on the type of Element given. If there is no default type of Component for the given Element, then null will be returned.
Parameters:
element - to return default Component type for
Returns:
a String containing the default Component class name else null

getSuggestedComponents

public java.util.Vector getSuggestedComponents(org.w3c.dom.Element element)
Returns a Vector of suggested Component class names for given Element. This method will choose the appropriate Components based on the type of Element given. The default Component type will be the first in the list.

If the Element has an ID, then the DocumentElement Component will be added to the end of the suggestion list.

If the id contains the TEMPLATE_NODE keyword, then a Template will be added to the top of the suggestion list.

If there are no suggested types of Component for the given Element, then an empty Vector will be returned.

Subclasses should override this method if more than the Element tag name is needed to determine the suggested components.

Parameters:
element - to return default Component type for
Returns:
a Vector containing any suggested Component class names

getSuggestedComponents

protected java.util.Vector getSuggestedComponents(java.lang.String tagName,
                                                  java.lang.String id)
Returns a Vector of suggested Component class names for given Element. This method will choose the appropriate Components based on the type of tag given. The default Component type will be the first in the list.

If an ID is given, then the DocumentElement Component will be added to the end of the suggestion list.

If the id contains the TEMPLATE_NODE keyword, then a Template will be added to the top of the suggestion list.

If there are no suggested types of Component for the given tag, then an empty Vector will be returned.

Parameters:
tagName - to return default Component type for
ID - of the tag or null
Returns:
a Vector containing any suggested Component class names

bindComponent

public ValueHolder bindComponent(AbstractField field,
                                 java.util.Collection valueHolders)
Binds the given field to a ValueHolder by matching ID and alias. If the field's ID conforms to the Mapper naming standard, then this method attempts to bind it to a ValueHolder. The field's ID must contain a ValueHolder alias and a property name. The ID is tokenized (based on the defined separator string), and the first token is used to search through the ValueHolder collection to find a matching alias. If found, the field's valueHolder is set to the matching ValueHolder, and second token is used to set the field's propertyName. If no match is found, no action is taken.
Parameters:
field - is the AbstractField to bind
valueHolders - is the collection of possible valueHolders to bind to

autoCreateFields

public void autoCreateFields(Container container,
                             org.w3c.dom.Document document,
                             java.util.Collection valueHolders)
Automatically creates fields based on document, binds them to valueHolders and adds them to the container. It will not duplicate fields already in the container. Duplicates are determined by more than one field with the same ID.

initTagTable

protected abstract void initTagTable()
